title: Thailand takes another backward step by banning main opposition party
content: On Aug. 7, Thailand’s constitutional court banned Pita Limjaroenrat — the country’s most popular politician — from holding office and dissolved his party.
summary: On Aug. 7, Thailand’s constitutional court banned Pita Limjaroenrat — the country’s most popular politician — from holding office and dissolved his party.

title: Man stole thousands of rare ‘Bluey’ coins worth $393,000, police say
content: The man, who was arrested, stole 63,000 Bluey coins, or “Dollarbucks,” from the back of a truck, Australian police said. Only a tiny proportion have been recovered.
summary: The man, who was arrested, stole 63,000 Bluey coins, or “Dollarbucks,” from the back of a truck, Australian police said. Only a tiny proportion have been recovered.

title: Ukraine counts on its Olympic athletes to demonstrate ‘the will to win’
content: High jumper Yaroslava Mahuchikh and fencer Olga Kharlan are among those in Paris trying to not just excel, but to lift up the nation and act as diplomats.
summary: High jumper Yaroslava Mahuchikh and fencer Olga Kharlan are among those in Paris trying to not just excel, but to lift up the nation and act as diplomats.

title: Who are Hamas’s top leaders? What to know about Yehiya Sinwar.
content: Sinwar, Hamas’s leader in Gaza and the mastermind of the Oct. 7 attack on Israel, will succeed Ismail Haniyeh as the new head of its political bureau.
summary: Sinwar, Hamas’s leader in Gaza and the mastermind of the Oct. 7 attack on Israel, will succeed Ismail Haniyeh as the new head of its political bureau.

title: The seductive Spanish village where the past feels present
content: Spanish picnics, Flamenco guitar and Andalusian horses make the past feel present on the dusty road to El Rocío.
summary: Spanish picnics, Flamenco guitar and Andalusian horses make the past feel present on the dusty road to El Rocío.

title: Walz has a long history with China. But he’s not ‘pro-China.’
content: Vice President Harris’s running mate taught in China in 1989, sparking an enduring interest in the country but also leading him to criticize its human rights abuses.
summary: Vice President Harris’s running mate taught in China in 1989, sparking an enduring interest in the country but also leading him to criticize its human rights abuses.

title: Sea lions are mapping the ocean floor with cameras attached to their backs
content: The footage the sea lions captured also revealed “awe-inspiring” scenes, Australian researchers said, like sea lions flipping over rocks to catch octopus.
summary: The footage the sea lions captured also revealed “awe-inspiring” scenes, Australian researchers said, like sea lions flipping over rocks to catch octopus.

title: Who is Muhammad Yunus, Bangladesh’s new transitional leader?
content: Yunus, a Nobel laureate, has been asked to guide Bangladesh through its new transitory period. Here’s what you need to know about the country’s new leader.
summary: Yunus, a Nobel laureate, has been asked to guide Bangladesh through its new transitory period. Here’s what you need to know about the country’s new leader.

title: Chinese American scholar convicted of spying on dissidents for Beijing
content: Shujun Wang was arrested as part of a U.S. initiative to crack down on efforts by the Chinese government to surveil and harass its critics.
summary: Shujun Wang was arrested as part of a U.S. initiative to crack down on efforts by the Chinese government to surveil and harass its critics.

title: Sinwar to replace Haniyeh as Hamas political leader, cementing his power
content: His ascension solidifies his role as the paramount leader of Hamas, and underscores how its Gaza-based faction has consolidated control of the movement after Oct. 7.
summary: His ascension solidifies his role as the paramount leader of Hamas, and underscores how its Gaza-based faction has consolidated control of the movement after Oct. 7.

title: Washington and Arab states scramble to avert an all-out Middle East war
content: As Israel braces for an Iranian attack, and U.S. officials fume at Netanyahu, it’s unclear how much Washington can do to control the spiraling violence.
summary: As Israel braces for an Iranian attack, and U.S. officials fume at Netanyahu, it’s unclear how much Washington can do to control the spiraling violence.

title: Elon Musk says U.K. government, not social media, to blame for violence
content: Elon Musk has declared that “civil war is inevitable” in Keir Starmer’s Britain. A government minister called his comments “pretty deplorable.”
summary: Elon Musk has declared that “civil war is inevitable” in Keir Starmer’s Britain. A government minister called his comments “pretty deplorable.”

title: U.S. stock indexes move higher the day after global market rout
content: Japan’s benchmark Nikkei 225 index ended the day up 10.23 percent on Tuesday, after its biggest single-day point drop Monday.
summary: Japan’s benchmark Nikkei 225 index ended the day up 10.23 percent on Tuesday, after its biggest single-day point drop Monday.

title: Bangladesh’s Hasina faces the revenge of history
content: What comes next in Bangladesh is far from certain. The specter of further political violence is real.
summary: What comes next in Bangladesh is far from certain. The specter of further political violence is real.

title: Bangladeshi officials meet student demand to name Nobel laureate as leader
content: The selection of Muhammad Yunus by the president, security chiefs and student leaders represents an initial step to restoring order after Sheikh Hasina’s ouster.
summary: The selection of Muhammad Yunus by the president, security chiefs and student leaders represents an initial step to restoring order after Sheikh Hasina’s ouster.

title: Airlines cancel Middle East flights as escalation anxiety rises
content: Flight cancellations are affecting those trying to return home, as well as those trying to flee.
summary: Flight cancellations are affecting those trying to return home, as well as those trying to flee.

title: Five U.S. troops, 2 contractors injured in rocket attack in Iraq
content: U.S. troops at Al Assad air base in Iraq were wounded in a rocket attack carried out by Iranian-back militants, the Pentagon said.
summary: U.S. troops at Al Assad air base in Iraq were wounded in a rocket attack carried out by Iranian-back militants, the Pentagon said.

title: Most Americans oppose sending U.S. troops to defend Israel, poll finds
content: The findings come as tensions with Hezbollah and a threat from Iran loom over Israel. The United States has repositioned military assets in the region in recent days in preparation to defend Israel.
summary: The findings come as tensions with Hezbollah and a threat from Iran loom over Israel. The United States has repositioned military assets in the region in recent days in preparation to defend Israel.

title: Why has the Japanese stock market been on a roller-coaster ride?
content: Record fall one day, record rise the next. The Japanese stock market is gyrating in part because the country’s currency has been weakening — until last month.
summary: Record fall one day, record rise the next. The Japanese stock market is gyrating in part because the country’s currency has been weakening — until last month.

title: TikTok to remove feature for some users after E.U. says it’s addictive
content: TikTok Lite is removing a rewards program in E.U. countries after regulators accused the company of creating addictive features that could harm children.
summary: TikTok Lite is removing a rewards program in E.U. countries after regulators accused the company of creating addictive features that could harm children.

title: U.N. fires Gaza staff, citing possible involvement in attack on Israel
content: The U.N. fired nine employees of UNRWA, a key relief agency in Gaza, after determining they “may have been involved” in the Oct. 7 Hamas-led attack on Israel.
summary: The U.N. fired nine employees of UNRWA, a key relief agency in Gaza, after determining they “may have been involved” in the Oct. 7 Hamas-led attack on Israel.

title: Houthi drone expert among those killed in U.S. strike in Iraq
content: A Houthi commander’s death in Iraq illustrates the cooperation among Iran-backed groups in the Middle East as the region faces the threat of worsening violence.
summary: A Houthi commander’s death in Iraq illustrates the cooperation among Iran-backed groups in the Middle East as the region faces the threat of worsening violence.

title: Israel on alert for retaliation; U.S. officials say attack may be imminent
content: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu discussed preparations for counterstrikes with his security cabinet. Hamas and Iran blame Israel for the killing of a Hamas leader.
summary: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu discussed preparations for counterstrikes with his security cabinet. Hamas and Iran blame Israel for the killing of a Hamas leader.

title: Mali cuts ties with Ukraine, claiming Kyiv’s involvement in rebel attacks
content: Kyiv said Mali failed to provide evidence of any Ukrainian involvement in the attacks by Tuareg rebels in northern Mali that killed Russian and Malian troops.
summary: Kyiv said Mali failed to provide evidence of any Ukrainian involvement in the attacks by Tuareg rebels in northern Mali that killed Russian and Malian troops.

title: Maduro perdió las elecciones según actas recopiladas por la oposición
content: Edmundo González habría vencido al presidente Nicolás Maduro el 28 de julio por millones de votos, según muestra un análisis de datos de las actas electorales.
summary: Edmundo González habría vencido al presidente Nicolás Maduro el 28 de julio por millones de votos, según muestra un análisis de datos de las actas electorales.

title: Bangladeshi Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina resigns and flees country
content: Hasina’s resignation, announced by Gen. Waker-Uz-Zaman, comes after hundreds have been killed in clashes between protesters and security forces in recent weeks.
summary: Hasina’s resignation, announced by Gen. Waker-Uz-Zaman, comes after hundreds have been killed in clashes between protesters and security forces in recent weeks.

title: How the U.S. military cultivated — and then lost — a key African ally
content: A timeline of key events in the lead-up to the U.S. troop withdrawal on Monday from the West African country of Niger.
summary: A timeline of key events in the lead-up to the U.S. troop withdrawal on Monday from the West African country of Niger.

title: U.S. troops withdraw from strategic West African base as militant threat grows
content: The U.S. military pullout from the sprawling Agadez base in Niger deals a setback to efforts at countering Islamist insurgents and resisting Russian influence.
summary: The U.S. military pullout from the sprawling Agadez base in Niger deals a setback to efforts at countering Islamist insurgents and resisting Russian influence.

title: Who is Sheikh Hasina, Bangladeshi leader who fled protests?
content: Sheikh Hasina resigned as Bangladesh’s prime minister following deadly protests, fleeing to India on Monday.
summary: Sheikh Hasina resigned as Bangladesh’s prime minister following deadly protests, fleeing to India on Monday.
